description_txt: stated on January 3, 2011 in a Wall Street Journal op-ed piece.:
quote_txt: "In 1998, nearly half of Florida's fourth-graders were functionally illiterate. Today, 72% of them can read."

description_txt: stated on January 2, 2011 in an interview on NBC's "Meet the Press":
quote_txt: "We have the highest (corporate tax rates) in the world right now."

description_txt: stated on December 15, 2010 in an interview with a weekly newspaper:
quote_txt: "I represent the fourth-poorest (congressional) district" in the nation.

description_txt: stated on December 20, 2010 in an interview with The Plain Dealer:
quote_txt: "We are one of only two states to have eight consecutive months of declining unemployment. Twenty-one states had increased unemployment last month. Ours went down."

description_txt: stated on December 23, 2010 in its website:
quote_txt: "The Greenest County in America."

description_txt: stated on November 30, 2010 in a newspaper article.:
quote_txt: Says Texas Railroad Commissioner Michael Williams has attended more than 150 tea party gatherings.

description_txt: stated on December 21, 2010 in a speech.:
quote_txt: Proposed federal regulations would affect every street sign in the country

description_txt: stated on December 5, 2010 in a newspaper article.:
quote_txt: Says one out of three U.S. homeless men is a veteran.

description_txt: stated on December 8, 2010 in in Clackamas County Board of Commissioners hearing :
quote_txt: Says "there is a plan formulated by Chair (Lynn) Peterson and the cities in Clackamas County to further increase this fee in three years and split it up on projects between the county and cities."

description_txt: stated on December 15, 2010 in a news release:
quote_txt: "In the last five years, 28,000 people have been killed along the U.S.-Mexico border."

description_txt: stated on December 20, 2010 in a news release.:
quote_txt: On whether the state should ramp up borrowing to build roads.

description_txt: stated on November 4, 2010 in an interview.:
quote_txt: "In 1981, Matagorda, Brazoria, and Galveston Counties all opted out of the Social Security program for their employees. Today, their program is very, very well-funded and there is no question about whether it’s going to be funded in" years to come.

description_txt: stated on December 16, 2010 in a news release.:
quote_txt: The tax-cut deal "adds more than $800 billion to the deficit over two years -- more than the cost of TARP and more than the cost of the Recovery Act" and about the same as health care reform.

description_txt: stated on November 30, 2010 in a press release:
quote_txt: Texas "children may have a teacher who never spent one minute practicing teaching."

description_txt: stated on December 12, 2010 in an ABC-6 interview program:
quote_txt: "Over 80 percent of the people want the shot to vote" on whether to approve same-sex marriage, according to polls.
footer: By C. Eugene Emery Jr. • December 26, 2010

description_txt: stated on December 1, 2010 in an op-ed:
quote_txt: "All but one of the 50 states already have some form of a balanced budget amendment in their state constitutions."

description_txt: stated on December 10, 2010 in a website posting:
quote_txt: Portland Public Schools invites "well-paid, well-fed school bureaucrats, administrators, teachers, other staff, non-needy students, affluent parents of students, and other adults, including on the other extreme the adult homeless, illegal aliens, fanatical Muslim terrorists, or drug addicted street people, to enjoy cheap breakfasts in taxpayer-paid school facilities amidst school children."

description_txt: stated on December 20, 2010 in a letter.:
quote_txt: "The Governor did not consult members of his own party before he released his [transportation] plan."

description_txt: stated on December 13, 2010 in a press release.:
quote_txt: Says Texas Republican leaders "have proposed laying off thousands of teachers."

description_txt: stated on December 8, 2010 in a newspaper interview:
quote_txt: House Speaker Dean Cannon says that freshmen lawmakers account for one-third of the 120-member House, and that two-thirds of the chamber have two years or less experience.

description_txt: stated on December 9, 2010 in an interview with a newspaper editorial board:
quote_txt: "We continue to see these isolated incidents of people trying to vote five, six times a day."

description_txt: stated on December 1, 2010 in a city council meeting:
quote_txt: Four out of 10 homicides are committed by gun in this city.

description_txt: stated on December 15, 2010 in a U.S. House floor speech.:
quote_txt: Says that "all those who do not answer directly to the president, they've said (repealing Don't Ask, Don't Tell) is a terrible idea."

description_txt: stated on December 17, 2010 in a Dec. 19, 2010 speech to legislators. :
quote_txt: On whether state employees should contribute to their pensions.

description_txt: stated on December 9, 2010 in his book "Decision Points.":
quote_txt: "Sen. Joe Biden, the ranking member of the Foreign Relations Committee, recommended partitioning Iraq into three separate entities."

description_txt: stated on December 20, 2010 in a message via the Internet:
quote_txt: Unemployment and the housing and auto industry crises can be fixed by giving a million dollars to every worker over age 50 to retire.
footer: By C. Eugene Emery Jr. • December 22, 2010

description_txt: stated on December 13, 2010 in comments at the launch of the NoLabels.org website.:
quote_txt: "We have dozens of districts that go for 150 to 200 miles, splitting counties, splintering cities and connecting areas that have very little in common."

description_txt: stated on December 14, 2010 in a meeting:
quote_txt: "You can go to Georgia and make about $6,000 more a year as a teacher."

description_txt: stated on December 20, 2010 in Washington, D.C.:
quote_txt: "CEOs now earn 431 times what their workers earn."

description_txt: stated on December 15, 2010 in a comment made during his radio show:
quote_txt: Says the University of Wisconsin football program is spending almost all of its Bowl Championship Series payout on a Rose Bowl junket for politically connected officials
